main event: A bright light in the sky was observed near Wallingford, Kentucky on September 8, 1959 that appeared to fade and reappear.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 15 minutes.
The witnesses, Mr. John Wills and Mrs. Elizabeth Wills, are considered to be reliable.
The description of the object does not provide sufficient detail to determine its nature.
Soil samples were taken for analysis after a sighting of a 'large flying disc' that hovered near the ground and then made a swift climb on September 6, 1959 in Wallingford, Kentucky.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witnesses: Mr. John Wills and Mrs. Elizabeth Wills
